result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabrielle J Jochims

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Acceptance to First Offender Program

Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 10:34am 
Defendant Gabrielle J Jochims in court with Attorney Clarice Perkins.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Perkins reports that she has received written discovery and she anticipates receiving digital discovery also.
Counsel request scheduling of a status conference further out, to allow time for Ms. Jochims to pursue possible entry into the First Offender Program.
Ms. Jochims indicates that Rogers Street address is current. 
recess 10:36am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on April 6th at 9:40am  (2) Status Conference on June 6th at 11:00am--this hearing will be removed from the calendar if verification of FOP admission is received before the hearing date

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on February 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on March 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ma] Case called at [All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Gabrielle J Jochims appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.Public Defender Cassi Nelson appears (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.

The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards anyone
--no violent contact and no discussion of the case with co-defendant, Jonathon Schroedl

recess 1:33 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/9/22 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference on 3/18/22 at 10:30am
